creator: fpahl@web.de
text:
The SVG spec says (Section 20.4, "The 'glyph' element")
that with respect to a glyph's 'd' attribute any styling
properties on the 'glyph' element itself are to be
ignored. SVGGlyphElementBridge, in line 87 of version
$Id: SVGGlyphElementBridge.java,v 1.8 2003/04/11 13:54:49 vhardy Exp $,
seems to use the fill rule specified on the 'glyph' element.

Incidentally, AdobeSVG Viewer also gets this wrong;
it ignores the fill-rule wherever you specify it
(on the 'glyph' or on the 'text'/'tspan') and always
uses the non-zero winding number rule for text filling.

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
This is fixed locally, and will be committed shortly.
(BTW I think this is a really unfortuate side effect of the 
glyph/property thing).
